title: Business & Finance
text:
Merck is in advanced talks to acquire Seagen and is aiming to finalize a purchase in the next few weeks, in a deal that could be worth roughly $40 billion or more.

---

Cryptocurrency broker and lender Voyager Digital filed for chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, becoming the latest victim of a chain reaction rippling through the crypto world.

---

FTX is seeking regulators' approval to let individual investors use derivatives to place leveraged bets on bitcoin, a move rivals oppose.

---

Amazon agreed to add Just Eat's Grubhub to its suite of Prime services in the U.S., in a deal aimed at expanding the food-ordering company's reach.

---

U.S. stocks ended higher after release of the Fed minutes, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow adding 0.4%, 0.3% and 0.2%, respectively. Oil prices moved lower.

---

Rivian said it produced 4,401 vehicles in the second quarter, exceeding analyst expectations, as the company fights headwinds to fulfilling customer orders.

---

Samsung Electronics ' string of record results is expected to end, as the global technology boom slows amid rising inflation and economic uncertainties.
